alert.note: Alert for Southern Seward Peninsula Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 21 at 4:06AM AKST until February 22 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AKST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow with low visibility occuring. Travel will be very difficult to impossible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches, are expected. Brief blizzard conditions will occur. Freezing rain is possible. * WHERE...Southern Seward Peninsula Coast. * WHEN...Until midnight tonight. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds gusting as high as 45 mph will cause areas of blowing and drifting snow with low visibility. The heaviest snowfall will be in the hills north of Nome. Periods of brief whiteout conditions can be expected. Freezing rain with a light glaze of ice is possible tonight. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Storm Warning for snow and blowing snow means severe winter weather conditions are occurring. This will make travel very difficult or impossible.
